metadata.notes: Synced from ERPNext. Many COGS accounts use descriptive names without account numbers.

overhead.description: Fees paid to attorneys, law firms, and legal service providers. Includes contract review, corporate filings, litigation costs, trademark/patent filings, and legal consultations. Does NOT include HR-related legal matters (use HR Consulting) or regulatory compliance fees (use Business Taxes & Licenses).

Promotional spending to attract customers. Includes digital ads (Google, Meta, LinkedIn), print advertising, trade show booths, promotional materials, branded merchandise, sponsorships, and marketing agency fees. Does NOT include website hosting (use Web Services) or sales commissions (use Commission on Sales).

Rent payments for administrative office space only. Does NOT include production facility rent, warehouse rent, or storage space (use Rent - Production and Storage for those). Includes office lease payments, co-working space fees, and executive suite rentals.

Shipping and mailing costs for administrative purposes. Includes USPS postage, FedEx/UPS shipments for documents, certified mail, PO box fees, and courier services. Does NOT include delivery of customer goods (use Delivery Cost accounts) or shipping supplies (use Office Expenses).

Charitable contributions and donations to nonprofits. Includes cash donations, sponsorships of charitable events, and in-kind donations. Does NOT include political contributions (not deductible) or marketing sponsorships where company receives promotional benefit (use Advertising and Marketing).

Business travel costs for employees. Includes airfare, hotels, rental cars, rideshare (Uber/Lyft), parking, train tickets, and per diem meals while traveling. Does NOT include local commuting, delivery driver fuel (use Gas and Tolls), or client entertainment (use Advertising and Marketing).

Fees charged by financial institutions. Includes monthly account fees, wire transfer fees, ACH fees, NSF charges, and lockbox fees. Does NOT include merchant processing fees or credit card transaction fees (use Merchant Card Services), interest expense, or loan origination fees.

Uncollectible accounts receivable written off. Includes customer invoices deemed uncollectible after collection efforts fail. Does NOT include discounts given to customers, credit memos, or billing adjustments.

Miscellaneous indirect expenses that don't fit other overhead categories. Use sparingly for one-time or unusual items. If an expense recurs regularly, consider creating a dedicated account. Does NOT include operational mistakes (use SNAFU) or unclassified COGS items.

Government-required taxes, licenses, and permits to operate the business. Includes business license renewals, professional certifications, industry permits, franchise taxes, property taxes, and regulatory filing fees. Does NOT include income taxes or payroll taxes (use Payroll Taxes accounts).

Computer hardware and peripherals under the capitalization threshold. Includes laptops, monitors, keyboards, mice, printers, networking equipment, and accessories. Does NOT include software subscriptions (use Web Services) or IT consulting services (use separate consulting account).

Fees paid to external accountants and bookkeepers. Includes CPA services, tax preparation, audit fees, bookkeeping services, and financial consulting. Does NOT include accounting software subscriptions (use Web Services) or internal payroll costs (use Payroll accounts).

Payments to independent contractors for administrative/overhead work. Includes freelancers, consultants, and UpWork contractors for non-production tasks like design, writing, or IT support. Does NOT include subcontractors for laundry operations (use Operations Outsourcing) or delivery (use Subcontractor for Delivery).

Costs related to human resources and recruitment. Includes recruiting agency fees, job board postings (Indeed, LinkedIn), background checks, drug testing, HR consultants, and employee handbook development. Does NOT include payroll processing fees or employee benefits.

overhead.full_name_wcli: 5237 - Employee Benefits for Admin Staff - WCLI
overhead.full_name_wclc: 5237 - Employee Benefits for Admin Staff - WCLC
overhead.description: Benefits provided to administrative and overhead employees. Includes health insurance premiums, 401(k) contributions, life insurance, disability insurance, and other fringe benefits for non-production staff. Does NOT include direct labor benefits or payroll taxes (use Payroll Taxes accounts).

Business insurance premiums across all lines of coverage. Includes general liability, professional liability (E&O), directors & officers (D&O), cyber liability, umbrella policies, property insurance, vehicle insurance, and workers compensation. Does NOT include employee health insurance (use Employee Benefits accounts).

General office supplies and small equipment. Includes paper, pens, printer ink/toner, folders, binders, desk accessories, and furniture under capitalization threshold. Does NOT include computer equipment (use Computer Equipment), postage (use Postal Expenses), breakroom supplies, janitorial/cleaning supplies, or PPE (use PPE and Safety Supplies).

Gross wages for administrative and overhead employees. Includes salaries and wages for office staff, management, accounting, sales, and other non-production roles. Does NOT include production workers (use Payroll Gross accounts) or contractor payments (use Subcontractor 1099 or UpWork).

Employer payroll taxes for administrative and overhead employees. Includes employer portion of FICA (Social Security and Medicare), FUTA, SUTA, and other employment taxes for office and management staff. Does NOT include employee withholdings or workers compensation insurance.

Communication service costs for the business. Includes landline phone service, mobile phone plans, internet service, VoIP services, and conference call subscriptions. Does NOT include software subscriptions like Slack or Zoom (use Web Services) or equipment purchases (use Computer Equipment).

Software subscriptions and cloud-based services. Includes SaaS subscriptions (Slack, Zoom, Microsoft 365, QuickBooks), web hosting, domain registrations, cloud storage, and online tools. Does NOT include internet connectivity (use Telephone & Internet) or computer hardware (use Computer Equipment).

Fees for external business consultants and advisors. Includes management consultants, IT consultants, operations consultants, and other professional advisors. Does NOT include accounting (use Accounting Fees), legal (use Legal Expenses), or HR consulting (use HR Consulting & Hiring).

Memberships and subscriptions to professional organizations and industry resources. Includes trade association dues, industry publications, professional memberships (TRSA, chambers of commerce), and business research services. Does NOT include software subscriptions (use Web Services).

Fees for processing customer credit and debit card payments. Includes payment processor fees (Stripe, Square), credit card transaction fees, and merchant account charges. Does NOT include bank account fees (use Bank Fees and Charges) or point-of-sale hardware (use Computer Equipment).

Fees paid to payroll service providers. Includes payroll processing fees (Everee, Trinet, ADP, Gusto), direct deposit fees, and payroll tax filing fees. Does NOT include actual payroll taxes (use Payroll Taxes accounts) or HR services (use HR Consulting & Hiring).

Interest paid on business debt and financing. Includes interest on loans, lines of credit, equipment financing, and credit cards. Does NOT include principal payments, bank fees (use Bank Fees and Charges), or late payment penalties.

Business meals and entertainment expenses. Includes client meals, team lunches, business dinners, and entertainment for business purposes. Does NOT include employee breakroom supplies (use Break Room and Janitorial Supplies) or travel meals (use Travel Expenses).

Employee training and education expenses. Includes seminars, workshops, online courses, certifications, conference registrations, and training materials. Does NOT include college tuition reimbursement (use Employee Benefits) or trade association dues (use Professional business subscriptions).

General professional services not covered by specific accounts. Includes specialized consultants, technical advisors, and professional service providers. Use sparingly - prefer specific accounts like Legal Expenses, Accounting Fees, or Consulting when applicable.

cogs_delivery.description: Fuel and toll costs for delivery vehicles. Includes gasoline, diesel, and highway/bridge tolls for delivery trucks. Does NOT include natural gas for the plant (use Natural Gas), vehicle maintenance (use Routine Maintenance on Trucks), or employee mileage reimbursements (use Travel Expenses).

Lease payments and mileage charges for delivery vehicles. Includes monthly truck lease payments, per-mile overage charges, and fleet rental fees. Does NOT include fuel (use Gas and Tolls), maintenance (use Routine Maintenance on Trucks), or insurance (use Insurance).

Regular maintenance and repairs for delivery vehicles. Includes oil changes, tire replacements, brake service, inspections, and minor repairs. Does NOT include fuel (use Gas and Tolls), major accident repairs (use Vehicle Damage Claims and Repairs), or vehicle lease payments (use Vehicle Lease and Mileage).

Maintenance and repairs for delivery bicycles and e-bikes. Includes tire replacements, brake repairs, chain maintenance, and tune-ups for bikes used in delivery operations. Does NOT include truck maintenance (use Routine Maintenance on Trucks) or bike purchases over capitalization threshold.

Payments to third-party contractors for delivery services. Includes courier services, overflow delivery help, and contracted drivers. Does NOT include employee driver payroll (use Payroll Gross - Delivery), outsourced washing (use Outsourcing Washing), or administrative contractors (use Subcontractor 1099 or UpWork).

cogs_production.description: Laundry chemicals and cleaning agents used in production. Includes detergents, softeners, bleach, stain removers, sour, and other wash chemicals. Does NOT include janitorial cleaning supplies (use Break Room and Janitorial Supplies) or equipment lubricants (use Plant Equipment - Components for Repairs).

Fees paid to use coin-operated laundry equipment at external facilities. Includes laundromat fees for overflow or specialty items. Does NOT include outsourced washing services (use Outsourcing Washing) or equipment for owned coin-op machines.

Purchase of linens held as rental inventory. Includes sheets, towels, tablecloths, napkins, and other textiles purchased to expand or replace rental inventory. Does NOT include customer-owned goods, cleaning supplies, or one-time linen purchases for resale.

Packaging materials for laundry operations. Includes poly bags, garment bags, laundry bags, shrink wrap, and plastic sheeting used in production. Does NOT include trash bags (use Break Room and Janitorial) or shipping boxes (use Postal Expenses).

Personal protective equipment and safety items for production staff. Includes gloves, safety glasses, ear protection, steel-toe boots, hard hats, high-visibility vests, hair nets, shoe covers, LOTO (Lock Out Tag Out) supplies, and first aid supplies. Does NOT include uniforms without safety features or office supplies.

Consumable parts for laundry equipment that require regular replacement. Includes ironer wax, guide tape, thermal oil, ironer pads, folder textiles, and similar items. Does NOT include durable parts or components for repairs (use Plant Equipment - Components for Repairs).

cogs_production.full_name_wcli: Break Room and Janitorial Supplies - WCLI
cogs_production.full_name_wclc: Break Room and Janitorial Supplies - WCLC
cogs_production.description: Consumables for employee break areas and facility cleaning. Includes paper towels, toilet paper, trash bags, cleaning chemicals, dish soap, coffee, snacks, and janitorial supplies. Does NOT include PPE (use PPE and Safety Supplies) or office supplies (use Office Expenses).

Rent for production facilities, warehouses, and storage space. Includes laundry plant rent, warehouse leases, and off-site storage facilities. Does NOT include administrative office rent (use Office Rent) or equipment leases.

Payments to third-party laundries for overflow or specialty washing. Includes fees paid to other laundry facilities to process goods when capacity is exceeded or for specialized cleaning. Does NOT include delivery subcontractors (use Subcontractor for Delivery) or intra-company transfers (use Intra-Party Subcontractors).

Payments between related companies (WCLC, WCLDC, WCLI) for shared services or overflow work. Includes inter-company laundry processing, shared delivery runs, and allocated overhead. Does NOT include third-party vendors or unrelated subcontractors.

cogs_maintenance.full_name_wcli: Plant Equipment - Components for Repairs - WCLI
cogs_maintenance.full_name_wclc: Plant Equipment - Components for Repairs - WCLC
cogs_maintenance.description: Supplies and components to repair laundry equipment. Includes replacement pumps, inverters, bearings, gaskets, motors, and lubricants for servicing. Does NOT include consumable parts replaced annually or more frequently (use appropriate consumables account) or third-party service fees (use Plant Equipment - Third Party Service).

cogs_maintenance.full_name_wcli: Plant Equipment - Third Party Service - WCLI
cogs_maintenance.full_name_wclc: Plant Equipment - Third Party Service - WCLC
cogs_maintenance.description: Service fees for third-party technicians to repair plant equipment on-site. Includes factory representative visits, boiler technicians, and specialized repair contractors. Does NOT include parts purchased separately (use Plant Equipment - Components for Repairs) or in-house maintenance labor.

Repairs and maintenance for production facility buildings. Includes HVAC repairs, plumbing, electrical work, roof repairs, painting, and general facility upkeep. Does NOT include equipment repairs (use Plant Equipment accounts) or janitorial services (use Break Room and Janitorial Supplies).

Durable tools and equipment under $5,000 that are expensed rather than capitalized. Includes drills, hand tool sets, toolboxes, cabinets, meters, multimeters, and diagnostic instruments. Tools over $5,000 should be capitalized as fixed assets. Does NOT include consumable supplies or parts.

cogs_utilities.description: Electricity utility costs for production facilities. Includes electric bills for laundry plant operations, lighting, and equipment power. Does NOT include natural gas (use Natural Gas) or office electricity if billed separately.

Natural gas utility costs for production operations. Includes gas used for boilers, dryers, and heating production/warehouse facilities. Does NOT include propane, electricity (use Electricity account), or gas for delivery vehicles (use Gas and Tolls).

Water and sewer utility costs for production operations. Includes water used in washing processes, facility water usage, and municipal sewer charges. Does NOT include water delivery services or bottled water for staff (use Staff Amenities).

Waste disposal and recycling services for production facilities. Includes dumpster rental, trash hauling, recycling pickup, and hazardous waste disposal. Does NOT include office trash service if billed separately.

cogs_staff.description: Food and non-cash perks for production staff. Includes team meals, pizza parties, birthday celebrations, employee appreciation gifts, and morale-boosting expenses. Does NOT include breakroom supplies (use Break Room and Janitorial Supplies) or business meals with clients (use Meals and Entertainment).

Branded apparel for employees. Includes T-shirts, jackets, and other Wash Cycle branded gear. Does NOT include PPE items with safety features (use PPE and Safety Supplies) or general work clothes without branding.

cogs_staff.full_name_wcli: Employee Benefits for Production Staff - WCLI
cogs_staff.full_name_wclc: Employee Benefits for Production Staff - WCLC
cogs_staff.description: Benefits provided to direct labor employees. Includes health insurance premiums, 401(k) contributions, life insurance, and other fringe benefits for production, delivery, and maintenance workers. Does NOT include admin staff benefits (use Employee Benefits for Admin Staff) or payroll taxes.

cogs_mistakes.description: Miscellaneous operational errors and unexpected costs that don't fit other categories. Includes one-time mistakes, unusual losses, and unclassifiable operational expenses. Use sparingly - most expenses should be categorized to a specific account.

cogs_mistakes.full_name_wcli: Customer Credits for Service Errors - WCLI
cogs_mistakes.full_name_wclc: Customer Credits for Service Errors - WCLC
cogs_mistakes.description: Credits issued to customers due to service failures. Includes credits for late deliveries, damaged items, lost goods, or quality issues caused by operational mistakes. Does NOT include incentive discounts, promotional credits, or billing error corrections (those should be deducted against revenue).

Traffic violations and regulatory fines related to operations. Includes parking tickets, moving violations, DOT fines, overweight citations, and other regulatory penalties. Does NOT include business license fees (use Business Taxes & Licenses) or vehicle damage (use Vehicle Damage Claims and Repairs).

cogs_mistakes.full_name_wcli: Vehicle Damage Claims and Repairs - WCLI
cogs_mistakes.full_name_wclc: Vehicle Damage Claims and Repairs - WCLC
cogs_mistakes.description: Costs from vehicle accidents and major damage repairs. Includes collision repairs, insurance deductibles, third-party damage claims, claims from the Enterprise Damage Recovery Unit, and body work from accidents. Does NOT include routine maintenance (use Routine Maintenance on Trucks) or traffic tickets (use Tickets and Fines).

5541.notes: Gas stations - use Gas and Tolls for delivery team, Travel for admin

7512.notes: Car rental - delivery vs admin travel

key_changes: OLD: 5110 Gas Tolls Fines -> NEW: Gas and Tolls (no account number, COGS)
OLD: 5120 Vehicle Leases Mileage -> NEW: Vehicle Lease and Mileage (no account number, COGS)
OLD: 5130 Delivery Subcontractors -> NEW: Subcontractor for Delivery (no account number, COGS)
OLD: 5150 Coin Wash Fees -> NEW: Coin Wash Fees (no account number, COGS)
OLD: 5200 Maintenance -> Split into: Plant Equipment - Components for Repairs, Plant Equipment - Third Party Service, Building Maintenance, Routine Maintenance on Trucks
OLD: 5220 Employee Food -> NEW: Employee Food and Perks (no account number, COGS)
OLD: 5660 Shipping Supplies -> NEW: 5210 Postal Expenses (overhead)
OLD: 5700 Telephone Internet -> NEW: 5242 Telephone & Internet
OLD: 5900 Web Services -> NEW: 5243 Web Services
OLD: 5400 Office Expenses -> NEW: 5239 Office Expenses
OLD: 5020 Advertising Marketing -> NEW: 5207 Advertising and Marketing
classification_notes.account_naming: Many COGS accounts now use descriptive names without account numbers. The full ERPNext account name is '{account_name} - {company_suffix}'
classification_notes.overhead_vs_cogs: Pay attention to category - overhead accounts are indirect expenses, COGS accounts are direct costs of production/delivery
